column4: When Unix was first created, most "daemons" used to run under those accounts.
For example, many Unix machines had UUCP, and the UUCP daemon used the 'uucp' account. I don't know why wasn't the account removed from today's systems though
Basically, most of those accounts are still present purely for compatibility reasons: some programs still break if these accounts don't exist.
All accounts with user IDs less than 1000 are system accounts.
